newsitem.title: ARGENTINA: Enron said interested in Argentina pipeline.
newsitem.headline: Enron said interested in Argentina pipeline.

text.p: U.S. firm Enron Corp is interested in expanding an Argentine natural gas pipeline to supply Brazil and Uruguay, the state-run Telam news agency reported Friday.
Enron is considering a project to expand a 16-inch pipeline in the province of Entre Rios to 18 inches and install compression plants in the Argentine town of Concepcion del Uruguay, Telam reported.

"The possibility of investing in the province exists, beginning with the basic idea of expanding the gas pipeline to give it the transport capacity to supply markets in Brazil and Uruguay," said Enron spokesman James Bannantine, quoted by Telam.
No Enron spokesman in Argentina was immediately available for comment.
